dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Kicking off with some weather news, Kazhydromet is out with their forecast for the next few days in Kazakhstan, June 17th, 18th, and 19th.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] So, it sounds like we're in for some pretty unstable weather, unfortunately. A northwestern cyclone is just, uh, moving across most of the country.

dialogue_turns.text: Oh, wow. Hail. So, a bit cooler there, I guess?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: A little, yeah. Nighttime temps dipping slightly, from say, 17-25 down to 15-23 degrees Celsius. And daytime highs dropping too, from 25-35 down to 20-31. So, a bit of a relief.

dialogue_turns.text: So, basically, get ready for a scorcher if you're in the east or southeast.

dialogue_turns.text: Phew. And, uh, for the rest of June, any long-term outlook?
